heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Exempted 

Traveller) (Covid-19) (Amendment) (No. 8) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 11th day of August

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the Health
Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the Health
heading: 2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Exempted Traveller) (Covid-19)
text_raw:
2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Exempted Traveller) (Covid-19) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 134 of 2021) is amended by the substitution of the 
following definition for the definition of “vaccination certificate”: 

“ ‘vaccination certificate’ means - 

(a) 

an EU Digital Covid Certificate referred to in Article 3(1)(a) of 
the Digital Covid Certificate Regulation, or 

(b) 

a Covid-19 certificate that has been - 

(i) 

issued by a state other than a Member State, and 

(ii) 

recognised as equivalent to a certificate referred to in 
paragraph (a) pursuant to an implementing act adopted by 
the Commission in accordance with Article 3 or Article 8 
of the Digital Covid Certificate Regulation, 

that demonstrates that the person to whom it relates is a vaccinated 
person;”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 13th August, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [419] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

10 August, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [419]

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the Health
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations made under Sections 5, 31A (inserted by section 10 of the 
Health (Preservation and Protection and other Emergency Measures in the Public 
Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) and 38G (inserted by section 7 of the Health 
(Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 1 of 2021)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947) 
amend the regulations set out in SI 134 of 2021 to amend the definition of 
‘vaccination certificate’. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [419] 5
